title: Understanding Systematic Errors
text: Systematic errors are consistent and repeatable errors that occur in the same direction every time a measurement is taken. They can be caused by faulty equipment or a flawed experimental design.

hintAnswer: An error that consistently occurs in the same direction.
title: Identifying Systematic Errors
text: Which of the following best describes a systematic error?
choices: An error that consistently occurs in the same direction.

title: Examples of Systematic Errors
text: Consider a scale that is not calibrated correctly. Every measurement taken with this scale will be off by the same amount, either too high or too low.

hintAnswer: By calibrating equipment and refining experimental procedures.
title: Correcting Systematic Errors
text: How can systematic errors be minimized or corrected in an experiment?
choices: By calibrating equipment and refining experimental procedures.
By using a different type of error analysis.
